Respondents were included in the sample based on a national and a Budapest probability sample. The Budapest sample was created with a sampling process that stratified the sample based on districts. The national sample was created with a multi-stage, proportionally stratified selection. At the first stage settlements were selected based on 9 settlement strata. At the second stage a simple random sampling process defined the number of persons in the sample from the specific settlements based on the population ratio of the individual strata. The selection of the respondent was based on the number of adults and adult men in the households, using the Leslie Kish-key.
